metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17810 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Netwide Assembler (NASM) 2.14rc0, there is a "SEGV on unknown address" that will cause a remote denial of service attack, because asm/preproc.c mishandles macro calls that have the wrong number of arguments.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nasm - 2.13.02-0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nasm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.13.02-0.1').
